description:
• The most well-known source-based distribution (packages are built on the user's machine).
• Most notable feature is USE flags, which allow users to not only pick which packages are installed on their machine, but also what each package will support.
• Supports overlays, custom repositories, over the official repository.
• Supports OpenRC and systemd as init systems. One is chosen during install and can be changed later.
• Package installation and updates can take a long time for big applications. These applications may also have a binary option, but you lose the configurability of USE flags by opting to use binary packages.
• Not beginner friendly. The community is willing to help those who show that they have put effort into solving a problem, but those who cannot/do not have the knowledge to help themselves should stay away.
    
[Download Gentoo Linux](https://www.gentoo.org/downloads/)
